page.title: 03Landscape
page.content: The land rises from the valley of the River Rother in the eastern area of the rectangle fairly steeply towards Middle Handley & Nether Handley on the western side.The area is largely rural,consisting of scattered farms, farming villages,and small pockets of industry around Barrow Hill and the Lowgates area of Staveley.Centuries of mining for iron and coal have affected the landscape.There are areas of woodland and rough pasture but the majority of the land is given over to mixed farming.There are no major roads in the area.A main line railway from Sheffield to the Midlands runs through the area with extensive branch lines and sidings to serve the needs of local industry.
